messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: digital cameras
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks! Kristen ... From: Anne B  To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com Sent: Monday, December 30, 2002 11:11 PM Subject:
messages.messageBody:
Thanks!
Kristen
----- Original Message -----
From: Anne B <WildWingsAcademy@...>
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, December 30, 2002 11:11 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: digital cameras


--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, Have a Nice Day!
<litlrooh@c...> wrote:
> Can anyone recommend a good digital camera that is less than a
hundered dollars?

I got a digital camera for Christmas; dh found one that was
refurbished. It was about $100 and has all the features I wanted
(compact, picture display, zoom lens, crisp pictures, no delay
between pushing the button and the picture being taken, etc.).
It's a Kodak DX3215; he got it from tigerdirect.com. His stragegy
was to research cameras with desired features, then did a google
search to see who carried them refurbished, thus cutting the price to
1/2 to 1/3 of new.

HTH,
Anne.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] digital cameras
messages.msgSnippet: We bought an old Nikon Cool Pix 100 off of Ebay for 80 bucks. It works really well. Easy to use, great pictures! I think you can now find them even cheaper. We
messages.messageBody:
We bought an old Nikon Cool Pix 100 off of Ebay for 80 bucks. It works really well. Easy to use, great pictures! I think you can now find them even cheaper.
We have since upgraded because I really wanted to see the pictures right when we took them. But my husband is still using the Cool Pix at work and when he happens to see something he wants a picture of. lol

HTH
Kathy Sullivan:
Mom to Logan 15, Andrew 10, Alexander 6 1/2, and Christopher David 14 months.

DFW-Unschoolers-subscribe@yahoogroups.com

"Some people think that we put our lives on hold to raise a child, but we know that to hold a child IS life"

"To be free to learn, children must be free to dream!"

----- Original Message -----
From: Have a Nice Day!
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, December 27, 2002 3:07 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] digital cameras


Can anyone recommend a good digital camera that is less than a hundered dollars?

Thanks.
Kristen


****************************************************************

Today is even more important than tomorrow because "today" is a gift, and "tomorrow" might never come.

Today is where hope lives because today is when we can make things better than yesterday.

The only thing we can be sure of is today and life isn't worth living if it isn't lived in joy for as many moments of today as we can manage.
